Test 1

For the first test I have to print Bizz for multiples of 3, Appz for multiples of 5 and BizzAppz for multiples of both. 'BizzAppz' is convenient because it's simple to just concatenate the case for multiples of 3 and 5 so it doesn't require extra logic. I chose to make two versions, a normal, readable/extendable version like I would probably write in a normal environment. Besides that a fun version which is basically just one line to do it all. The only downside of the oneliner is readability, for a teammember it would be difficult to wrap his head around.

(Output in console)

Test 2

For this test I have to write a class that extends another class. I made 3 classes to demonstrate inheritance: ClassA, which is the base class, it has a method called reverse that will reverse a string. ClassB, which extends ClassA and therefore is able to also reverse a string. ClassC, which does not extend anything, just to test/confirm/demonstrate that instances of ClassC are NOT instances of ClassA.

(Output in console)

Test 3

For this test I have to fetch, parse, group and sum the CSV data before putting it into a graph.

Test 4

To get the contents of 2 url's I used the modern "fetch" api which returns 2 promises. I then wait for those promises to be resolved and I console log the data.

(Output in console, takes some time)
